unnormalised: **Gas Cylinder Prices: Ouch! Kitchen Budgets Feel the Heat!**
normalised: **Gas Cylinder Prices: Ouch! Kitchen Budgets Feel the Heat!**

unnormalised: Looks like your chai and pakora nights might be getting a tad more expensive, folks! Latest reports indicate another hike in domestic LPG cylinder prices. Dr. Sharma from the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas cited global energy market volatility as the reason.
normalised: Looks like your chai and pakora nights might be getting a tad more expensive, folks! Latest reports indicate another hike in domestic L P G cylinder prices. Doctor Sharma from the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas cited global energy market volatility as the reason.

unnormalised: For consumers in Delhi, a 14.2 kg cylinder will now cost Rs. 1150. Yikes! And it's not just Delhi; cities like Mumbai and Kolkata are feeling the pinch too.
normalised: For consumers in Delhi, a fourteen point two kilogram cylinder will now cost rupee one thousand one hundred and fifty. Yikes! And it's not just Delhi; cities like Mumbai and Kolkata are feeling the pinch too.

unnormalised: "This is impacting middle-class families like mine," says Priya, a homemaker from Lucknow. "We're already juggling rising food prices. Every single rupee counts!"
normalised: "This is impacting middle-class families like mine," says Priya, a homemaker from Lucknow. "We're already juggling rising food prices. Every single rupee counts!"

unnormalised: Experts suggest exploring options like biogas or optimizing gas usage to save money. Think pressure cookers and efficient cooking techniques, like your grandma used to do. And maybe cut down on that extra cup of evening chai…unless you grow your own tea on 100 sq ft of land, of course! Seriously though, this price hike is no laughing matter. What will the government do next?
normalised: Experts suggest exploring options like biogas or optimizing gas usage to save money. Think pressure cookers and efficient cooking techniques, like your grandma used to do. And maybe cut down on that extra cup of evening chai…unless you grow your own tea on one hundred square feet of land, of course! Seriously though, this price hike is no laughing matter. What will the government do next?
